p: First of all, the peculiar fragrance of many monoterpenes, present principally in aromatic plant essential oils, makes this class of compounds extremely important for food, aromatherapy, and perfumes. In addition to the fragrance, monoterpenes from essential oils, such as thymol, thymine, and carvacrol (found principally in plants belonging to the Lamiaceae family) proved interesting also for their numerous biological activities, for instance, their potential in the treatment of disorders affecting respiratory, nervous, and cardiovascular systems, and as antimicrobial and antioxidant agents [ 112].
